One of the benefits of using a LinkedBlockingDeque is that it blocks :) But you're trying to use it in a non-blocking manner. Think through what interface you want this spool to have, and then choose an appropriate structure.
In my initial skeleton, I used this because I wanted the spool.pop() method to block. The thread waiting for messages would run when connected, and stop when disconnected. Here, you're using a scheduled executor service instead, and are polling. With this model you don't want to block. A simple linked list would work better.

timeline.message: Ensure that EventLoopGroup is always closed if some exception occurs (#577)

Suspend service lifecycle when config is being merged during deployment (#567)

* Suspend service lifecycle when config is being merged.

Configuration is updated asynchronously on each node, this will cause services to start with old config.
Postponse installing/starting when config is being updated in deployment,
so that service won't be started with partially updated config.

* Address comments

Co-authored-by: Xueli Zheng <shirlez@amazon.com>

handle config update when default value is specified in the using Parameters: (#578)

* handle config update when default value is specified in the Parameters section

Set the owner of artifacts for a service when commands are first run. (#555)

* Set the owner of artifacts for a service when commands are first run.

Refactored generation of the user/group to run a service with.

Artifacts are set to the user/group running the service.
The run as user is set for a component in the deployment. If none is
provided, the default user/group is used. If no default is set, and
the kernel user is not root, the kernel user is used.

Artifacts that are not "run" are left unchanged - they are owned by
the kernel user.

Set artifact and artifact dir permissions

Permissions will be set to world readable for artifacts - this is temporary until the component model change is consumed

The artifacts directories need to be globally readable and executable so any user can enter the directories - otherwise sharing artifacts does not work

Ownership of artifacts directories is set to the nucleus user. Ownership of artifact files is set to the user running the component (or default user)

Fixes so tests run as non-root user

Add default user and group to easy setup

Proper config interpolation using timestamps (#580)

* Proper config interpolation using timestamps

* Revert "handle config update when default value is specified in the using Parameters: (#578)"

This reverts commit 19958f5b58c11bbb668114aacccea8656d062ddd.

* Add test case for resolving with different timestamps

* Simplify RESET behavior

Updating IPC library for server, client and model (#583)

* Updating IPC library for server, client and model

* Replacing InvalidArgumentError with InvalidArgumentsError

Co-authored-by: fahadmohammed01 <52720275+fahadmohammed01@users.noreply.github.com>
